If you are experiencing thoughts of self-harm or suicide, please reach out to a trusted friend, family member, or mental health professional for help. You can also call emergency services or a helpline such as the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (in the United States) at 1-800-273-TALK (8255) for confidential support 24/7.

It's important to recognize that attributing suicidal thoughts or behaviors to a stable attributional style can be harmful and dismissive of the complex underlying issues. Instead, it's crucial to address the root causes of these feelings and provide support and resources for those who are struggling.
